How does ESMFold contribute to the study: By aiding in the design of nanobody binders targeting the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein.
By sequencing the SARS-CoV-2 genome more efficiently.
By predicting the epidemiological spread of SARS-CoV-2.
What challenges in protein modeling are: Modeling intrinsically disordered regions and simple α-helical domains in viral proteins.
Predicting the complete genome sequence of RNA viruses.
Designing vaccines that target multiple viral strains.
Developing antiviral drugs with minimal side effects.
What is the primary focus of the paper ': The structural characterization of viral proteins within Orthornavirae, including unannotated proteins referred to as 'dark matter'.
The development of new antiviral drugs targeting Orthornavirae.
The genetic sequencing of RNA viruses within Orthornavirae.
The epidemiological study of Orthornavirae infections in humans.
What opportunities does the use of ESMFo: Exploring the structural landscape of viral proteins to develop innovative therapeutic strategies.
Increasing the speed of viral genome sequencing.
Enhancing the accuracy of viral infection diagnostics.
Reducing the cost of antiviral drug production.
